org.tantalum.net
Class StaticWebCache

java.lang.Object
  org.tantalum.storage.StaticCache
      org.tantalum.net.StaticWebCache

public class StaticWebCache
extends StaticCache

A cache of remote http contents backed by local flash memory storage

Author:
tsaa

get

public Task get(java.lang.String key,
                byte[] postMessage,
                int priority,
                int getType,
                Task chainedTask)
Retrieve one item from the cache using the method specified in the getType parameter. The call returns immediately, is executed concurrently on a worker thread, and code in the Task will be executed automatically on a Worker and optionally also the UI thread after the get operation completes. Normal use case is to specify the method StaticWebCache.GET_ANYWHERE. This attempts get in the following order: 1. RAM if available: Task return is fast but still asynchronous 2. Local flash storage (RMS or database depending on the platform) if available: may take several milliseconds, or longer if the Worker task queue is long and you do not specify high priority. 3. web: may take several seconds for a HTTP response which is then cached locally automatically. The get() call returns immediately, is executed concurrently on a worker thread, and code in the Task will be executed automatically on a Worker and optionally also the UI thread if UITask after the get operation completes.

Parameters:
key - - The web service location to HTTP_GET the cacheable data
postMessage - - Optional HTTP POST body
priority - - Worker.HIGH_PRIORITY, Worker.NORMAL_PRIORITY, or Worker.LOW_PRIORITY
getType - - StaticWebCache.GET_ANYWHERE, StaticWebCache.GET_WEB, or StaticWebCache.GET_LOCAL
chainedTask - - your Task, UITask, or AsyncTask which is executed after the get operation using the data retrieved.
Returns:
a new Task containing the result

prefetch

public void prefetch(java.lang.String key)
Retrieve the object from WEB if it is not already cached locally.

Parameters:
